title: Style blogger slams critics who say she glorifes obesity
text: Share this article Share The woman, in her 30s, says her blog is designed to encourage both men and women to begin embracing their lives, regardless of their size. 'My aim is to encourage all women (and men if they’re interested in such things) to live full, happy, exciting lives starting right now,' she explained. Style queen: The Queensland woman uses her blog, Suger Coat It, to share plus size style tips, musings about body confidence and to share details of her sunny holidays 'Not ten years from now and certainly not 10kg from now. 'If that is glorifying obesity because I, a fat person, encouraged you to do that, bloody hell, I’ve been doing that this whole time. 'I probably owe someone an apology. Here I am, glorifying obesity all over the place. 'I was thinking I was a human doing things and forgot that you see me only as a fat woman who shouldn’t be happy or visible or considered remotely cool.' Unapologetic: She claims people have only taken issue because she is the face of her blog, and appears to be confident in her own skin Self love: Mrs Walker Horn told her Instagram following she loved her body because: 'I've got better things to do with my time than hate myself 24/7' Mrs Walker Horn describes the website as a 'scrapbook without glue'. Its pages cover style for plus-sized women, body confidence and healthy and hearty recipes. Under the 'Lifestyle' section, posts vary widely, covering her holidays, working life, teen safety online and general life advice. In an Instagram post promoting an email challenge she sent out to her followers, she gave a brief summary of the reason she loved her body most. Bluntly, she wrote: 'I've got better things to do with my time than hate myself 24/7.' Read more: Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
